title: Add Privacy Policy page with Stack Teacher branding and styled cookies table

requirements.summary: Create a new PrivacyPolicyPage component containing the full Privacy Policy content with Stack Teacher branding, contact details, and styling matching TermsOfUsePage
acceptanceCriteria: No occurrences of 'Careerist', 'careerist.com', or 'support@careerist.com' appear anywhere on the page
All email addresses show as support@stackteacher.com or compliance@stackteacher.com
Address displays as '30 N Gould St Ste N, Sheridan, WY 82801, USA'
Brand name 'Stack Teacher' is used consistently throughout
Page renders without errors and matches the visual style of TermsOfUsePage

file_operations.description: Create a new Privacy Policy page component that mirrors the layout and typography of TermsOfUsePage.tsx. Include all standard privacy policy sections (Information Collection, Use of Information, Cookies, Data Security, Third-Party Services, User Rights, Children's Privacy, Changes to Policy, Contact Information) with Stack Teacher branding throughout. Use 'Stack Teacher' as the company name, 'stackteacher.com' as the domain, 'support@stackteacher.com' and 'compliance@stackteacher.com' for email contacts, '30 N Gould St Ste N, Sheridan, WY 82801, USA' as the physical address, and '1234567890' as the phone number. Apply the same heading hierarchy, spacing, and Tailwind CSS classes used in TermsOfUsePage for visual consistency.

requirements.summary: Replace plain-text cookie descriptions with a styled HTML table listing cookie categories, names, purposes, and durations using Tailwind CSS
acceptanceCriteria: A visually styled cookies table is present in the Cookies section of the Privacy Policy page
Table includes columns for at minimum: Cookie Name/Type, Purpose, and Duration
Table uses Tailwind CSS classes for borders, padding, and alternating row colors
Table is wrapped in an overflow-x-auto container for mobile responsiveness

file_operations.description: Within the Cookies section of PrivacyPolicyPage, add a styled HTML table with columns for Cookie Name/Type, Purpose, and Duration/Expiry. Include representative cookie categories (Essential, Analytics, Functional, Marketing) with example cookies for each. Wrap the table in a div with 'overflow-x-auto' class for mobile responsiveness. Apply Tailwind classes to the table for borders ('border', 'border-border'), cell padding ('px-4 py-2'), header styling ('bg-muted font-semibold'), and alternating row colors ('even:bg-muted/50'). Ensure the table is visually consistent with the site's design system.

requirements.summary: Register a new /privacy-policy route in App.tsx that renders the PrivacyPolicyPage component
acceptanceCriteria: The route is defined inside the shared Layout root route, consistent with all other routes

file_operations.description: Add a new route definition for '/privacy-policy' within the Layout root route configuration, following the same pattern as the existing '/terms' route. Import PrivacyPolicyPage from '../pages/PrivacyPolicyPage' and register it as the component for the new route. Ensure the route is added alongside other informational routes (terms, about) and does not break existing routing.

requirements.summary: Add a 'Privacy Policy' link in the footer of Layout.tsx that navigates to /privacy-policy
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Privacy Policy' link is visible in the footer
The link styling is consistent with the existing 'Terms of Use' footer link

file_operations.description: In the footer section of Layout.tsx, add a 'Privacy Policy' link that navigates to '/privacy-policy'. Place the link near the existing 'Terms of Use' link, using the same Link component and styling (text size, color, hover effects). Ensure the link is properly spaced and visually consistent with other footer links.
